title: LG Unveils G4 Smartphone
text:
29 July 2015 14:13 CET LG Unveils G4 Smartphone By Daily Guide 
Staff of LG (left) explain features of the G4 to a customer after the launch 
LG's much-anticipated LG G4 smartphone was over the weekend introduced onto the local market at the Holiday Inn Hotel in Accra. 
The LG G4, which is already available in LG's shops across the country, delivers comfortable elegance, a great visual experience and a human-centric user experience. 
Juno Cho, President and CEO of LG Electronics Mobile Communications Company, who officially launched the product, described the G4 as LG's most ambitious smartphone currently. 
'We are living up to our promise of Innovation for a Better Life with a fashionable, premium smartphone that is more focused on delivering a balanced user experience that can compete with the best of the best,' said Juno. 
He added: 'We wanted to give consumers a truly human-centric device that combined the analog sensibilities with technologies that delivered real world performance. From the design to the camera to the display to the UX, this is the most ambitious phone we've ever created,' he noted. 
The LG G4 is a smartphone which features a back cover with full grain, handcrafted leather, a 5.5-inch Quad HD display, a six core Snap Dragon 808 processor, 3GB of RAM and a 16-megapixel back camera, as well as an eight-megapixel front camera. 
The LG G4 camera features a rare-in-smartphones F1.8 aperture lens which allows 80 percent more light to hit the image sensor than in the LG G3. 
The innovative camera module is paired with the new IPS Quantum Display that is better in every way than the innovative Quad HD display introduced to the world in the LG G3. 
The LG G4 embodies human sensibility that is clearly visible in its Slim Arc exterior design and graphical user interface.
